q_en: Which materials have been allocated for all cutting tasks that are assigned to Expert Cutters and have not been completed, organized by cutting task?

steps.sql: SELECT ct.id AS cutting_task_id, m.name AS material_name, cma.allocated_num FROM cutting_tasks ct JOIN working_group wg ON ct.working_group_id = wg.id JOIN cutting_material_allocation cma ON ct.id = cma.cutting_task_id JOIN warehouse_material wm ON cma.warehouse_material_id = wm.id JOIN materials m ON wm.material_id = m.id WHERE wg.name = 'Expert Cutters' AND ct.status != 2;
steps.description: To find the materials allocated for all cutting tasks assigned to the working group 'Expert Cutters' that have not been completed, we need to join the cutting_tasks, working_group, cutting_material_allocation, and materials tables. We will filter the tasks by the working group name and task status, and then select the relevant material information organized by cutting task.

response:
Sure thing! Let's dive into the materials allocated for the cutting tasks assigned to the "Expert Cutters" group that haven't been completed yet. Here's a neat table to show you the details:

| Cutting Task ID | Material Name      | Allocated Quantity |
|-----------------|--------------------|--------------------|
| 19              | Cotton Fabric      | 95                 |
| 21              | Cotton Fabric      | 85                 |
| 34              | Cotton Fabric      | 330                |
| 11              | Wool               | 140                |
| 16              | Wool               | 200                |
| 20              | Wool               | 90                 |
| 26              | Wool               | 70                 |
| 27              | Wool               | 60                 |
| 11              | Silk               | 140                |
| 16              | Leather            | 200                |
| 20              | Leather            | 90                 |
| 27              | Leather            | 60                 |
| 19              | Synthetic Fiber    | 95                 |
| 21              | Synthetic Fiber    | 85                 |
| 34              | Synthetic Fiber    | 330                |
| 8               | Denim Fabric       | 50                 |
| 16              | Down               | 200                |
| 27              | Down               | 60                 |

I hope this helps you get a clear picture of the materials allocated for each task! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. ğŸ˜Š
